name: ToonComposer
description: Streamlining Cartoon Production with Generative Post-Keyframing
readme_summary: ToonComposer streamlines cartoon production by using generative AI for post-keyframing, automating the inbetweening and colorization processes. It reduces the manual effort traditionally required in animation, turning hours of work into a seamless process. The tool provides a Gradio interface for users to interact with the model and generate animations.
key_features: Model weights available on Hugging Face
primary_use_case: Streamlining cartoon and anime production by automating the inbetweening and colorization processes.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled clockmaker meticulously crafting a cuckoo clock where each animated figure represents a frame of a cartoon. The clockmaker uses a magical brush that automatically fills in the movements between the key figures, bringing the clock to life with fluid animation. Small UI elements display the ToonComposer logo and animation parameters. The scene is set in a whimsical workshop filled with gears, springs, and colorful animation cells. Digital particles flow from the brush, enhancing the animation. The composition is focused and vibrant with a warm color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details.

name: buster
description: An advanced tool for email reconnaissance
readme_summary: Buster is an OSINT tool designed for email reconnaissance. It gathers information about an email address, including associated social media accounts, data breaches, and links where the email was found. It can also generate possible email addresses and usernames, find emails from social media accounts or usernames, and discover work emails.
key_features: Get social accounts of an email
Get links to where the email was found
Get domains registered with an email (reverse whois)
Find the email of a social media account
Find the work email of a person
cover_image_prompt: A detective in a dimly lit, high-tech office, meticulously piecing together a digital profile from scattered email fragments. The detective uses a magnifying glass that highlights connections to social media accounts, data breaches, and online mentions, which appear as glowing nodes on a holographic display. Small screens show reverse whois lookups and email generation algorithms. The office is filled with subtle tech elements, such as digital particles forming email addresses and the Buster logo subtly integrated into the detective's workstation. The image should be in a digital painting style with clear outlines and a focus on detail.

name: rustnet
description: A cross-platform network monitoring terminal UI tool built with Rust.
readme_summary: RustNet is a cross-platform network monitoring tool built with Rust that provides real-time visibility into network connections. It offers detailed state information, connection lifecycle management, deep packet inspection, and a terminal user interface for monitoring network activity.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a seasoned detective, magnifying glass in hand, meticulously examining a complex network of interconnected pipes representing network connections. The pipes glow with different colors indicating connection states, while data packets flow through them like water. The detective is focused on a specific junction, where a suspicious packet is being inspected by a miniature UI screen showing packet details. The scene is set in a dimly lit, futuristic control room with glowing monitors displaying network statistics. The repository name, 'RustNet,' is subtly etched on the detective's badge. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with a focus on clarity and detail.

name: tinyworlds
description: A minimal implementation of DeepMind's Genie world model
readme_summary: TinyWorlds is a minimal implementation of DeepMind's Genie world model, focusing on autoregressive, unsupervised learning for scalable world models. It aims to help users understand the Genie architecture by providing a simplified version with key components like video and action tokenizers, a dynamics model, and techniques like Space-Time Transformers and Variational Autoencoders.
primary_use_case: Understanding and experimenting with scalable world models based on DeepMind's Genie architecture.
cover_image_prompt: A cartographer meticulously drawing a map of an uncharted land, using fragments of video footage as their guide. The cartographer pieces together the landscape, predicting unseen areas based on observed patterns. Small screens display code snippets and training data, subtly connecting the map-making process to the underlying software. The scene is set in a sunlit workshop filled with scrolls and tools. Digital particles flow from the video fragments, aiding the cartographer's predictions. The composition is focused and clear, with a warm color scheme. The image should be in a detailed digital painting style.

name: blades
description: Blades is a Go-based multimodal AI Agent framework.
readme_summary: Blades is a Go-based multimodal AI Agent framework designed to facilitate the creation of intelligent agents. It supports custom models, tools, memory, and middleware, making it suitable for multi-turn conversations, chain-of-thought reasoning, and structured output. The framework emphasizes flexibility and extensibility through decoupled components and unified interfaces.
primary_use_case: Building multimodal AI agents and workflows in Go.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled architect meticulously assembling a complex structure from glowing, interconnected blocks, each representing a different AI component (model, tool, memory). The architect carefully connects these blocks to form a sophisticated AI agent, visualized as a futuristic robot. UI elements displaying Go code snippets and agent workflows float subtly in the background. The scene is set in a bright, modern design studio with a focus on clarity and precision. The composition is clean and focused, using a cool color palette of blues and greens. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with sharp details and a sense of technological advancement.

name: 30-Days-Of-Python
description: 30 days of Python programming challenge is a step-by-step guide to learn the Python programming language in 30 days. This challenge may take more than 100 days, follow your own pace.  These videos may help too: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7PNRuno1rzYPb1xLa4yktw
readme_summary: The 30 Days of Python repository is a step-by-step guide designed to help individuals learn the Python programming language over a 30-day period. It covers a wide range of fundamental Python topics, from basic syntax and data structures to more advanced concepts like web scraping and API development.
primary_use_case: Learning Python programming from beginner to intermediate level through a structured, daily curriculum.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a student climbing a staircase made of Python code, each step representing a different concept like 'Variables', 'Loops', and 'APIs'. At the top, the student reaches a platform overlooking a landscape of diverse applications like web development, data analysis, and automation, all powered by Python. The staircase glows with a soft, digital light, and small screens embedded in the steps display code snippets and tutorials. The repository name, '30 Days of Python', is subtly etched into the platform. The scene is set in a bright, optimistic atmosphere. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clear labels.
